dataset.title: LAGOS-NE-GIS v1.0: A module for LAGOS-NE, a multi-scaled geospatial and temporal database of lake ecological context and water quality for thousands of U.S. Lakes: 2013-1925

creator.organizationName: Michigan State University
Michigan State University

abstract.para: This data package, LAGOS-NE-GIS v1.0, is 1 of 5 data packages associated with the LAGOS-NE database-- the LAke multi-scaled GeOSpatial and temporal database. Three of the data packages each contain different types of data for 51,101 lakes and reservoirs larger than 4 ha in 17 lake-rich U.S. states to support research on thousands of lakes. These three package are: (1) LAGOS-NE-LOCUS v1.01: lake location and physical characteristics for all lakes. (2) LAGOS-NE-GEO v1.05: ecological context (i.e., the land use, geologic, climatic, and hydrologic setting of lakes) for all lakes. These geospatial data were created by processing national-scale and publicly-accessible datasets to quantify numerous metrics at multiple spatial resolutions. And, (3) LAGOS-NE-LIMNO v1.087.1: in-situ measurements of lake water quality from the past three decades for approximately 2,600-12,000 lakes, depending on the variable. This module was created by harmonizing 87 water quality datasets from federal, state, tribal, and non-profit agencies, university researchers, and citizen scientists. The other two data packages contain supporting data for the LAGOS-NE database: (4) LAGOS-NE-GIS v1.0: the GIS data layers for lakes, wetlands, and streams, as well as the spatial resolutions that were used to create the LAGOS-NE-GEO module. (5) LAGOS-NE-RAWDATA: the original 87 datasets of lake water quality prior to processing, the R code that converts the original data formats into LAGOS-NE data format, and the log file from this procedure to create LAGOS-NE. This latter data package supports the reproducibility of LAGOS-NE-LIMNO.

The LAGOS-NE GIS v1.0 module includes GIS datasets for: lake polygons and their hydrologic classification; wetland polygons and their classification; streams as a line coverage and their classification by stream order; the zones used for this study (state and county; hydrologic units [at the 4, 8 and 12 scales]); and, lake watersheds (IWS). We also include boundaries of U.S. states and Canadian provinces for mapping.

purpose.para: We have created a database for lakes in the northeastern-most 17 U.S. states called LAGOS-NE (LAke multi-scaled GeOSpatial and temporal database). We had three related motivations for developing this database: (1) to develop the basic understanding of lake nutrients and productivity at sub-continental scales, with a focus on studying cross-scale interactions and their drivers using water quality data on thousands of lakes collected overacross the last several decades (see Soranno et al. 2014 and Soranno et al. 2015 for details); (2) to build the capacity to apply this scientific understanding to environmental management and policy of freshwaters; and, (3) to foster broad-scale research by designing an open-science database infrastructure that includes detailed characterization of lake ecological context that is extensible for future uses and by making the data and methods publicly accessible. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database is provided for the purposes of displaying LAGOS-NE data, understanding their geospatial relationships, and supporting further spatial analyses with these data. This dataset shows LAGOS-NE HU12 polygons for which complete GEO data may not be available. Along the U.S.-Canada border, raster data may not completely "cover" a HU12 zone and so these HU12s are nullified in the GEO data exports.

spatialVector.entityDescription: LAGOS-NE contains data for all 51,102 lakes and reservoirs > 4 ha in the 17 U.S. state study area and along their borders (1,800,000 sq. km.), referred to as the census lake population. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database complements three data modules called LAGOS-NE-LOCUS, LAGOS-NE-GEO, and LAGOS-NE-LIMNO. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database contains geospatial data layers describing the boundaries, spatial classifications, and freshwater features used to compile the LAGOS-NE database. The dataset contains LAGOS-NE HU12 polygons that intersect the U.S.-Canada border.

attribute.attributeDefinition: TNMID (short for The National Map Identification) is a unique 40-character field that identifies each element in the database exclusively. TNMID is an automatically assigned code that stays with each element. When an element is updated or changed, TNMID links the element to the metadata record and documents the change. TNMID is also used to maintain relationship classes in the normalized data model. When an element is deleted or split, TNMID stays with the original element and is not used again. When an element is split, new permanent identifiers are assigned to the resultant parts.

spatialVector.entityDescription: LAGOS-NE contains data for all 51,102 lakes and reservoirs > 4 ha in the 17 U.S. state study area and along their borders (1,800,000 sq. km.), referred to as the census lake population. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database complements three data modules called LAGOS-NE-LOCUS, LAGOS-NE-GEO, and LAGOS-NE-LIMNO. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database contains geospatial data layers describing the boundaries, spatial classifications, and freshwater features used to compile the LAGOS-NE database. The LAGOS-NE EDU layer represents (modified) Ecological Drainage Units regions within the LAGOS-NE study region. This dataset is a conflation of a finer-resolution dataset (Water Boundary Dataset HU8, 24K) and a coarser-resolution dataset (National Fish Habitat Action Plan EDU, 250K) so that the pattern of spatial divisions chiefly follows the original EDUs available but the boundary linework is adopted from the HU8 linework. Manual interpretation was also required to complete this dataset. More details are available in Processing Step(s).

externallyDefinedFormat.formatName: zip file with ARC/INFO shape file

description.para: We obtained the original EDU features from a National Fish Habitat Action Plan dataset (online link provided is to latest version of dataset, not the one originally downloaded). We created a coverage of EDUs for LAGOS-NE that would share boundary linework with the other Watershed Boundary Dataset regionalizations as follows: We rasterized the original EDUs and transferred the values to the higher-resolution HU8 polygons via zonal statistics operations that assigned an EDU to a HU8 polygon. Linkage was based on the majority of original EDU raster cells that fell inside each of the HU8 polygons. While most polygon boundaries were roughly coincident, there are a few areas (mostly in the western polygons) where the 250K linework and the 24K linework were notably dissimilar. In these areas, linework may have been manually interpreted. Finally, the new EDU polygons were clipped to the geometry of the LAGOS_NE_Study_Extent polygon.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The States or outlying area attribute identifies the State(s) or outlying areas that the hydrologic unit falls within or touches. The U.S. Census Bureau 1:100,000-scale State layer will be used to establish State boundaries in the derivation process. The two-letter U.S. Postal Service State abbreviation is assigned. If a hydrologic unit crosses into Canada, the two-letter Canada Post abbreviation for the Province is used. If a unit crosses into Mexico, the MX designation is used. If more than one abbreviation is used, they are separated by commas, without spaces, and are sorted in alphabetical order. This field is populated by the In-State Steward at the 12-digit hydrologic unit.

textDomain.definition: List of state names

attribute.attributeDefinition: AreaAcres is common to all polygon feature classes and is calculated at the 12-digit hydrologic unit from the intrinsic area value maintained by the GIS software; therefore, acreage values may vary from user calculations, depending on the projection of the data. North American Albers Equal Area Conic, North American Datum 1983 is the required projection to use for calculation. If the units of the area field are stored in square meters, then use the conversion factor 0.0002471. For example, 40,469,446 square meters multiplied by 0.0002471 = 10,000 acres.

spatialVector.entityDescription: LAGOS-NE contains data for all 51,102 lakes and reservoirs > 4 ha in the 17 U.S. state study area and along their borders (1,800,000 sq. km.), referred to as the census lake population. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database complements three data modules called LAGOS-NE-LOCUS, LAGOS-NE-GEO, and LAGOS-NE-LIMNO. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database contains geospatial data layers describing the boundaries, spatial classifications, and freshwater features used to compile the LAGOS-NE database. The LAGOS-NE HU8 layer is a subset of the NRCS WBDHU8 layer and polygon reshaping (clipping) was only performed along the U.S. Canada border for this layer. See Process Step(s) for more information.

externallyDefinedFormat.formatName: zip file with ARC/INFO shape file

description.para: We downloaded the version of the NRCS Water Boundary Dataset issued on June 2013. We used the HUC8 layer to create a master study boundary to be used to clip the other hydrologic unit spatial classifications to a common study extent. Methods: 1) Clip the features to the United States boundaries. HUC8s that were entirely in Canada were removed entirely, while those that were at least partly in the US were kept, but their geometry was modified to be clipped at the border. This clip operation was performed using the US_Study_Bounds polygon in CSI_Master_Geodatabase_2014_*.gdb. 2) Select HUC8s with ? 10% of their area within the 17 study states to retain in the feature class. This was accomplished by first using Tabulate Intersection to identify the percentage of a HUC8 falling within the state boundaries above. HUCs that were clipped at the border in step 1 were considered 100% within the US for this step and so none of these HUCs were removed in this step-the order of the steps is important if this process is repeated. 3) Drop the HUC8s that correspond to the Long Island Sound, the Delaware Bay, and the five Great Lakes.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The States or outlying area attribute identifies the State(s) or outlying areas that the hydrologic unit falls within or touches. The U.S. Census Bureau 1:100,000-scale State layer will be used to establish State boundaries in the derivation process. The two-letter U.S. Postal Service State abbreviation is assigned. If a hydrologic unit crosses into Canada, the two-letter Canada Post abbreviation for the Province is used. If a unit crosses into Mexico, the MX designation is used. If more than one abbreviation is used, they are separated by commas, without spaces, and are sorted in alphabetical order. This field is populated by the In-State Steward at the 12-digit hydrologic unit.

TNMID (short for The National Map Identification) is a unique 40-character field that identifies each element in the database exclusively. TNMID is an automatically assigned code that stays with each element. When an element is updated or changed, TNMID links the element to the metadata record and documents the change. TNMID is also used to maintain relationship classes in the normalized data model. When an element is deleted or split, TNMID stays with the original element and is not used again. When an element is split, new permanent identifiers are assigned to the resultant parts.

spatialVector.entityDescription: LAGOS-NE contains data for all 51,102 lakes and reservoirs > 4 ha in the 17 U.S. state study area and along their borders (1,800,000 sq. km.), referred to as the census lake population. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database complements three data modules called LAGOS-NE-LOCUS, LAGOS-NE-GEO, and LAGOS-NE-LIMNO. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database contains geospatial data layers describing the boundaries, spatial classifications, and freshwater features used to compile the LAGOS-NE database. The LAGOS-NE IWS layer contains interlake watershed polygons for all of the LAGOS-NE lakes greater than or equal to 4 hectares. The watershed delineations were performed with an automated process custom to LAGOS-NE and are defined as follows: The area of land that drains directly into a lake, and into all upstream-connected, permanent streams to that lake exclusive of any upstream lake watersheds for lakes ? 10 ha that are connected via permanent streams.

externallyDefinedFormat.formatName: zip file with ARC/INFO shape file

description.para: The complete documentation of the process is found in Soranno et al. (2015), Supplemental File 8, located at http://dx.doi.org/10.1186/s13742-015-0067-4. The major steps in the watershed delineation process are as follows: 1) Obtain and mosaic NED DEMs, NHD data. Introduce 'walls' that prevent flow from crossing HU8 boundaries. Data is projected here to USGS Albers coordinate system, and later as necessary. 2) DEM conditioning: Burn NHD flowlines (streams, and more*) into DEM using AGREE-like conditioning. This step ensures that flow accumulates into cells that correspond with the NHD flowlines. 3) DEM conditioning: Fill pits in the DEM. This step prevents flow from accumulating in isolated pits (Jenson and Domingue 1988). 4) Force the flow to not cross HU8 boundaries by adding 'walls' along the boundary. 5) Calculate D8 flow direction from the DEM. 6) Select pour points: All NHD flowlines and lakes meeting the size threshold and being of certain FCodes (non-intermittent lakes and reservoirs) are included. Lakes take precedence where lakes and flowlines (in particular, artificial paths through lakes) overlap. 7) Calculate watersheds from the flow direction rasters using the selected pour points. 8) Remove watersheds smaller than 1ha and those that do not intersect the NHD flowlines or selected lakes. Use a 'nibble' algorithm to partition the areas where watersheds were removed into the retained watersheds. 9) Ensure that watershed polygons do not cross HU8 boundaries and that the lakes are perfectly nested within their own watersheds. 10) Aggregate watersheds. An aggregated watershed is created for each eligible lake in the NHD. The lake itself is erased from the watershed polygon and any remaining holes smaller than 3.9 ha are filled in. a. 'Interlake watersheds': All of the watersheds corresponding to network elements (lakes/streams) upstream of any eligible lake are merged until a 10-hectare lake is reached in the network, and no watersheds including and beyond the 10-hectare lake are included. b. 'Cumulative watersheds': All watersheds corresponding to network elements (lakes/streams) upstream of any eligible lake are merged until the HU8 boundary prevents any additional watersheds from being included. The lake itself is erased from the watershed polygon and any remaining holes smaller than 3.9 ha are filled in.

spatialVector.entityDescription: LAGOS-NE contains data for all 51,102 lakes and reservoirs > 4 ha in the 17 U.S. state study area and along their borders (1,800,000 sq. km.), referred to as the census lake population. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database complements three data modules called LAGOS-NE-LOCUS, LAGOS-NE-GEO, and LAGOS-NE-LIMNO. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database contains geospatial data layers describing the boundaries, spatial classifications, and freshwater features used to compile the LAGOS-NE database. The LAGOS-NE All Lakes (1ha) layer is a subset derivative of the National Hydrography Dataset NHDWaterbody dataset that contains a polygon for each lake larger than the 1-hectare cut-off in the LAGOS-NE study region.

externallyDefinedFormat.formatName: zip file with ARC/INFO shape file

description.para: We downloaded the NHD data staged by subregion for 65 subregions with the following codes or code ranges: 0101-0110, 0202-0205, 0207, 0401-0415, 0501-0504, 0506, 0508-0509, 0512, 0514, 0701-0714, 0801-0802, 0902-0903, 1017, 1023-2024, 1028-1030, 1101, 1107. We calculated the Lake Connection value using the Lake Connectivity tool in the LAGOS GIS Toolbox. We filtered the features to keep only the permanent lakes and reservoirs over 1 hectare in size using the following query: AreaSqKm">=0.01 AND ("FCode"=39000 OR "FCode"=39004 OR "FCode"=39009 OR "FCode"=39010 OR "FCode"=39011 OR "FCode"=39012 OR "FCode"=43600 OR "FCode"=43613 OR "FCode"=43615 OR "FCode"=43617 OR "FCode"=43618 OR "FCode"=43619 OR "FCode"=43621 OR ("FCode"=43601AND"AreaSqKm">=0.1)). We merged the features from all subregions, deleting duplicates of the same Permanent_Identifier by keeping the lake with the most recent FDate. We also removed duplicates with differing Permanent_Identifiers that overlapped >90% by keeping the lake with the latest FDate. The dataset was re-projected and the Lake_Area_Ha value was calculated after re-projection. The lake features were spatially joined to the WBD dataset to calculate the hydrologic unit, EDU, county, and state that contained them (either entirely, or if the lake was on the border, the region that contained the lake's centroid). The "OUT_OF_*" identifier was assigned with the lake fell outside all regions. Some lakes were manually assigned to a state at the end of this process. The lagoslakeid identifier was generated.

attribute.attributeDefinition: A class assigned based on the presence of upstream surface hydrological connections to the lake, and the presence of stream-connected upstream lakes (defined as a water body >= 10 ha).

Lakes connected to surface water through inflowing permanent streams, with no upstream lakes (>=10 ha), and may or may not have outflowing permanent streams.
Lakes with no inflow or outflow permanent streams.
Lakes at the headwater of a stream network (i.e. no inflowing permanent streams, but by definition, they DO have at least one outflowing permanent stream).

description.para: We downloaded the NHD data staged by subregion for 65 subregions with the following codes or code ranges: 0101-0110, 0202-0205, 0207, 0401-0415, 0501-0504, 0506, 0508-0509, 0512, 0514, 0701-0714, 0801-0802, 0902-0903, 1017, 1023-2024, 1028-1030, 1101, 1107. We calculated the Lake Connection value using the Lake Connectivity tool in the LAGOS GIS Toolbox. We filtered the features to keep only the permanent lakes and reservoirs over 1 hectare in size using the following query: AreaSqKm">=0.01 AND ("FCode"=39000 OR "FCode"=39004 OR "FCode"=39009 OR "FCode"=39010 OR "FCode"=39011 OR "FCode"=39012 OR "FCode"=43600 OR "FCode"=43613 OR "FCode"=43615 OR "FCode"=43617 OR "FCode"=43618 OR "FCode"=43619 OR "FCode"=43621 OR ("FCode"=43601AND"AreaSqKm">=0.1)). We merged the features from all subregions, deleting duplicates of the same Permanent_Identifier by keeping the lake with the most recent FDate. We also removed duplicates with differing Permanent_Identifiers that overlapped >90% by keeping the lake with the latest FDate. The dataset was re-projected and the Lake_Area_Ha value was calculated after re-projection. The lake features were spatially joined to the WBD dataset to calculate the hydrologic unit, EDU, county, and state that contained them (either entirely, or if the lake was on the border, the region that contained the lake's centroid). The "OUT_OF_*" identifier was assigned with the lake fell outside all regions. Some lakes were manually assigned to a state at the end of this process. The lagoslakeid identifier was generated. spatialVector.entityDescription: LAGOS-NE contains data for all 51,102 lakes and reservoirs > 4 ha in the 17 U.S. state study area and along their borders (1,800,000 sq. km.), referred to as the census lake population. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database complements three data modules called LAGOS-NE-LOCUS, LAGOS-NE-GEO, and LAGOS-NE-LIMNO. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database contains geospatial data layers describing the boundaries, spatial classifications, and freshwater features used to compile the LAGOS-NE database. The LAGOS-NE All Lakes (4ha) layer is a subset derivative of the National Hydrography Dataset NHDWaterbody dataset that contains a polygon for each lake larger than a 4-hectare cutoff in the LAGOS-NE study region.

externallyDefinedFormat.formatName: zip file with ARC/INFO shape file

description.para: We downloaded the NHD data staged by subregion for 65 subregions with the following codes or code ranges: 0101-0110, 0202-0205, 0207, 0401-0415, 0501-0504, 0506, 0508-0509, 0512, 0514, 0701-0714, 0801-0802, 0902-0903, 1017, 1023-2024, 1028-1030, 1101, 1107. We calculated the Lake Connection value using the Lake Connectivity tool in the LAGOS GIS Toolbox. We filtered the features to keep only the permanent lakes and reservoirs over 1 hectare in size using the following query: AreaSqKm">=0.01 AND ("FCode"=39000 OR "FCode"=39004 OR "FCode"=39009 OR "FCode"=39010 OR "FCode"=39011 OR "FCode"=39012 OR "FCode"=43600 OR "FCode"=43613 OR "FCode"=43615 OR "FCode"=43617 OR "FCode"=43618 OR "FCode"=43619 OR "FCode"=43621 OR ("FCode"=43601AND"AreaSqKm">=0.1)). We merged the features from all subregions, deleting duplicates of the same Permanent_Identifier by keeping the lake with the most recent FDate. We also removed duplicates with differing Permanent_Identifiers that overlapped >90% by keeping the lake with the latest FDate. The dataset was re-projected and the Lake_Area_Ha value was calculated after re-projection. The lake features were spatially joined to the WBD dataset to calculate the hydrologic unit, EDU, county, and state that contained them (either entirely, or if the lake was on the border, the region that contained the lake's centroid). The "OUT_OF_*" identifier was assigned with the lake fell outside all regions. Some lakes were manually assigned to a state at the end of this process. The lagoslakeid identifier was generated. Finally, the filter >= 4 hectares was applied to create this layer.

spatialVector.entityDescription: LAGOS-NE contains data for all 51,102 lakes and reservoirs > 4 ha in the 17 U.S. state study area and along their borders (1,800,000 sq. km.), referred to as the census lake population. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database complements three data modules called LAGOS-NE-LOCUS, LAGOS-NE-GEO, and LAGOS-NE-LIMNO. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database contains geospatial data layers describing the boundaries, spatial classifications, and freshwater features used to compile the LAGOS-NE database. The LAGOS-NE Study Extent layer contains a polygon boundary based on dissolved WBDHU8 polygons. See the Process Step(s) for more details about how it was defined.

externallyDefinedFormat.formatName: zip file with ARC/INFO shape file

description.para: We downloaded the version of the NRCS Water Boundary Dataset issued on June 2013. We used the HUC8 layer to create a master study boundary to be used to clip the other hydrologic unit spatial classifications to a common study extent. Methods: 1) Clip the features to the United States boundaries. HUC8s that were entirely in Canada were removed entirely, while those that were at least partly in the US were kept, but their geometry was modified to be clipped at the border. This clip operation was performed using the US_Study_Bounds polygon in CSI_Master_Geodatabase_2014_*.gdb. 2) Select HUC8s with ? 10% of their area within the 17 study states to retain in the feature class. This was accomplished by first using Tabulate Intersection to identify the percentage of a HUC8 falling within the state boundaries above. HUCs that were clipped at the border in step 1 were considered 100% within the US for this step and so none of these HUCs were removed in this step-the order of the steps is important if this process is repeated. 3) Drop the HUC8s that correspond to the Long Island Sound, the Delaware Bay, and the five Great Lakes. 4) Dissolve the polygons to form the master study extent polygon.

spatialVector.entityDescription: LAGOS-NE contains data for all 51,102 lakes and reservoirs > 4 ha in the 17 U.S. state study area and along their borders (1,800,000 sq. km.), referred to as the census lake population. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database complements three data modules called LAGOS-NE-LOCUS, LAGOS-NE-GEO, and LAGOS-NE-LIMNO. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database contains geospatial data layers describing the boundaries, spatial classifications, and freshwater features used to compile the LAGOS-NE database. The LAGOS-NE STATE layer is a dissolved subset of the 1:1,000,000-Scale County Boundaries of the U.S. dataset from the National Atlas.

externallyDefinedFormat.formatName: zip file with ARC/INFO shape file

description.para: We selected the counties with the STATE column equal to the abbreviations for the 17 states in LAGOS-NE. We dropped county polygons with FIPS codes ending in '000' as these represent boundaries through large water bodies and ocean that are not useful for LAGOS-NE summary data. The data were re-projected. The resulting LAGOS-NE COUNTY dataset was then dissolved on the STATE abbreviation field to yield 17 states for this dataset with boundaries aligned to the county representations.

spatialVector.entityDescription: LAGOS-NE contains data for all 51,102 lakes and reservoirs > 4 ha in the 17 U.S. state study area and along their borders (1,800,000 sq. km.), referred to as the census lake population. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database complements three data modules called LAGOS-NE-LOCUS, LAGOS-NE-GEO, and LAGOS-NE-LIMNO. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database contains geospatial data layers describing the boundaries, spatial classifications, and freshwater features used to compile the LAGOS-NE database. The Stream_Polygons layer is a subset of the National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) NHDArea features that represent double-banked streams or rivers as polygon regions to complement the stream centerline data. Only features for streams that also have a polyline feature in Stream_Polylines are included.

externallyDefinedFormat.formatName: zip file with ARC/INFO shape file

description.para: We downloaded the NHD data staged by subregion for 65 subregions with the following codes or code ranges: 0101-0110, 0202-0205, 0207, 0401-0415, 0501-0504, 0506, 0508-0509, 0512, 0514, 0701-0714, 0801-0802, 0902-0903, 1017, 1023-2024, 1028-1030, 1101, 1107. We merged the NHDArea features and then selected only the features with FType = 460 (StreamRiver).
